title: PROGRAM 2: ACTIVE LIFESTYLE
subtitle: Weeks 1-4: Building Base
subtitleDescription: These initial weeks establish a solid foundation by creating a consistent schedule with moderate intensity. You'll exercise 4 days per week, building both cardiovascular endurance and introducing structured strength training.
videoDescription: Learn the fundamental movement patterns that build true functional strength: squat, hinge, push, pull, carry, and rotate. These movements translate directly to real-life activities and athletic performance.
description: This 12-week program bridges the gap between sporadic exercise and a truly active lifestyle. It systematically increases both exercise frequency and intensity while introducing variety to prevent boredom. The program adds a second strength training day by week 5 and introduces interval training by week 9, preparing you for continued advancement in the months ahead.

sections.title: Overall Goals
items: Build cardiovascular endurance from 15 to 30 minutes
Build cardio endurance from 25 to 40 minutes
Establish consistent strength training 2x per week
Introduce interval training for improved fitness
Add flexibility work for injury prevention

items: Stand for 5 minutes every hour if you have a desk job

closingNote: Functional Fitness Philosophy: These 6 movement patterns aren't gym exercises - they're fundamental human movements you use every day. Squatting is sitting down and standing up. Hinging is picking something off the floor safely. Pushing and pulling open doors and carry groceries. By strengthening these patterns, you're not just building muscle - you're building a body that moves better, feels better, and handles life better. This is fitness with purpose.
